alert.note: Alert for Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 22 at 2:31AM MST until February 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches with locally greater amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Highlands, Northwest Plateau, West Central Mountains and West Central Plateau. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes portions of I-40. along and west of the Continental Divide. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow may create areas of poor visibility at times.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
